data.title: General correspondence (mainly non-estate) of the 1st Earl of Wharncliffe
data.meta_description: The official archive of the UK government. Our vision is to lead and transform information management, guarantee the survival of today's information for tomorrow and bring history to life for everyone.
data.text:
This follows on from the sequence Wh M/408-417, but the estate correspondence was mainly kept with the estate papers. The bundles are therefore small and consist of various non-estate business letters, begging letters and personal and family matters and public office.

Though never a front-rank politician (he was offered an under-secretaryship by Lord Derby), Lord Wharncliffe was active in many fields and his correspondence is of a varied nature.

The correspondence indexed contains much that is trivial, but a good deal will be found concerning such maters as local schools and church building, and from a number of figures in the art world whom Lord Wharncliffe patronised; and letters from may people well known in society in the later Victorian period.

In the index, items are listed by year date, followed by a number indicating how many letters, e.g. 1866 4 letters

Index of Correspondents:
